[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 102]
Reasoning: **Strategic Poker Decision Point**

Okay, here's the situation. It's Ante 6, Round 11, and I've got $28. My core strategy revolves around maximizing Three of a Kind (3OAK) hands with a focus on using Half Joker and Card Sharp to amplify the mult on small hands. I'm leveraging these to get the maximum benefit on low card hands.

I've got a decent Joker setup: Juggler for hand size, Wily Joker for Chips on 3OAK, Shoot the Moon for scaling, Half Joker for the mult and Card Sharp for the x3 mult. I am leveraging the Three of a Kind strategy and want to make the most of it.

I've got a few key Vouchers in play that could be useful, and my recent play has consistently been 3OAK to leverage my cards. I need to make some key decisions. I see two boosters in the shop: the Jumbo Arcana Pack and the Celestial Pack.

The Flower Pot is in the shop, but it is not ideal for the build I am working on. 

My initial thought was to prioritize leveling up 3OAK. This made the Celestial Pack the obvious choice to gain the Earth card.

So, I was ready to buy that. But, wait... I want to double-check my math.

Buying the Celestial Pack first costs $4, leaving me at $24, which is just under the interest threshold of $25. But leveling up 3OAK is key for scaling, so it is the most direct way to get chips and mult. It is worth it in the long run.

Ultimately, I will take the action: buy_booster 2

Reasoning: **My Decision for the Celestial Pack Selection**

Okay, here's the situation: Round 11, Celestial Pack open, $24 in the bank. My primary strategy is "Three of a Kind" (3OAK), heavily supported by Jokers like Wily (chip boost for 3OAK), Card Sharp (X3 mult on repeats), and Half Joker (mult boost for 3-card hands). I also have Juggler and Shoot the Moon, which impact hand size and Queen play, respectively. I also have several vouchers, but those aren't relevant for this decision.

The goal is always to maximize score, and right now, 3OAK is my go-to. I'm offered three Planet cards: Neptune (Straight Flush), Earth (Full House), and Saturn (Straight).

Immediately, I'm thinking, "Where's Mars? That's the 3OAK planet!" Unfortunately, it's not present. So, I need to evaluate these options. Neptune is out. Straight Flushes are rare for me, so I never play them. Saturn is a harder hand to hit. That leaves Earth (Full House).

Full House *contains* a 3OAK, which means Wily Joker triggers. But Full House requires five cards, which is bad since it means Half Joker won't trigger ("3 or fewer cards" condition). So, there is no direct synergy for 3OAK, but it's the closest thing.

Here's my analysis:
*   Neptune: Very rare for my strategy, not beneficial.
*   Earth: Full House. Might be useful as a safety net if I can't find a 3OAK. Earth *contains* a 3OAK, which activates Wily Joker but not Half Joker.
*   Saturn: Harder to hit. Breaks the "hold Queens" strategy more than Earth does.

Given the Card Sharp joker, I'll benefit by having a repeat hand. If I'm forced to play a Full House, the Earth card provides a good "safety net".

So, the optimal choice is Earth (Position 2). Skipping is almost never the best option.

I re-checked everything. Yes, Earth is the best option.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
select <pack_card_position> <hand_card_position1> <hand_card_position2> ... <hand_card_positionN> - Select a card from the booster pack. The hand card positions may be required depending on if the booster pack card selected needs targets. In 'Mega' booster packs that say 'choose 2 of N', make the selections one at a time. If you intend to select cards 1 and 3 for example, issue a 'select 1' command, then a 'select 2' command, because the 3rd card position will become the second position after selecting the first card.
skip_booster - Skip the remaining selections in the current booster pack.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
